com.safvan.util

Class LocalDateFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.safvan.util.LocalDateFormatter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.format.Formatter<java.time.LocalDate>, org.springframework.format.Parser<java.time.LocalDate>, org.springframework.format.Printer<java.time.LocalDate>

    @Component
public class LocalDateFormatter
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.springframework.format.Formatter<java.time.LocalDate>
    LocalDateFormatter class is a formatter for LocalDate objects. This class implements the Formatter interface provided by Spring Framework. It is used to parse LocalDate objects from text and format LocalDate objects to text. Spring automatically use this formatter for converting LocalDate objects to and from String representations. This allows seamless binding of LocalDate properties in your Spring MVC controllers and forms.
    See Also:
    https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/current/javadoc-api/org/springframework/format/Formatter.html

      java.time.LocalDate parse(java.lang.String text, java.util.Locale locale)
      Parse the text using the DateTimeFormatter.ISO_DATE formatter, which follows the ISO-8601 standard format for dates.
      java.lang.String print(java.time.LocalDate object, java.util.Locale locale)
      Format the LocalDate object as a String in the ISO-8601 date format.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public java.time.LocalDate parse(java.lang.String text,
                                 java.util.Locale locale)
                          throws java.text.ParseException
        Parse the text using the DateTimeFormatter.ISO_DATE formatter, which follows the ISO-8601 standard format for dates. The parsed LocalDate object is then returned.
        Specified by:
        parse in interface org.springframework.format.Parser<java.time.LocalDate>
        Parameters:
        text - the text to parse
        locale - the locale to use for parsing (ignored in this implementation)
        Returns:
        the parsed LocalDate object
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the text cannot be parsed as a LocalDate

      • print

        public java.lang.String print(java.time.LocalDate object,
                              java.util.Locale locale)
        Format the LocalDate object as a String in the ISO-8601 date format. The formatted String is then returned.
        Specified by:
        print in interface org.springframework.format.Printer<java.time.LocalDate>
        Parameters:
        object - the LocalDate object to format
        locale - the locale to use for formatting (ignored in this implementation)
        Returns:
        the formatted String
